channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 19
item.description:
August 19, 2020 7:55 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Wednesday, Aug 19.

item.title: No foul play in boy's fatal fall from flat: Coroner
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Alone at home, a three-year-old boy climbed through a window of a Housing Board flat onto a nearby air-conditioner ledge and fell from the seventh-storey unit.

item.title: Vaccine won't be a silver bullet, experts warn
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

A vaccine will not be a silver bullet to end the Covid-19 pandemic and the world still needs to improve its response to fight the virus.

item.title: Getai stars promote goods at virtual shows to weather hard times
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Some of Singapore's top getai singers and hosts will be selling products for corporations during Hungry Ghost Festival virtual performances, as a way to make up for a loss of income due to the Covid-19 pandemic, which has forced live getai shows to be cancelled.

item.title: People aged below 40 spurring spread in countries seeing a surge
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

The pandemic is changing as people in their 20s, 30s and 40s are increasingly driving the spread of Covid-19 infections in countries in this region that are seeing a surge in cases.

item.title: Baby found alive in rubbish chute: Mum given 18 months' jail
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

A woman who pleaded guilty to throwing her newborn son into a rubbish chute with the intention of killing him was given an 18-month jail term yesterday.

item.title: S'pore testing firm switches gears to work on masks
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Local testing and inspection company, Setsco Services, which ensures that stringent, high standards are upheld in a range of sectors like construction, manufacturing, as well as food and microbiology, has now pivoted to surgical mask testing amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: New grassroots initiative to help job seekers living in Bukit Panjang
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Job seekers living in Bukit Panjang can now turn to a new grassroots initiative for help and support.

item.title: About 100 workers in cleared dorms found Covid-19 positive during routine testing: MOM, MOH
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

About 100 migrant workers in dormitories previously cleared of the virus have tested positive for Covid-19 during routine biweekly testing.

item.title: Deputy commanding officer found guilty of negligent act
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

A Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF) officer was convicted by the district court yesterday over his involvement in a ragging incident that claimed the life of a full-time national serviceman (NSF) two years ago.

item.title: Coronavirus: Sole community case is 39-year-old Singaporean man working at bus depot
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

A 39-year-old Singaporean man who works at a bus depot in a "non-public facing" role is the sole community case announced by the Ministry of Health (MOH) yesterday.

item.title: SMC seeks to strike off man who listed fake co-authors in research
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

In an effort to boost his credibility in research papers submitted to medical journals, a trainee doctor claimed his work was co-authored by two people, named Mark Pitts and Peter Lemark, who turned out to be fictitious characters.

item.title: One of world's largest floating solar farms coming up in Tuas
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Sunny Singapore will have a floating solar farm in Tuas next year able to generate enough energy to power about 16,000 four-room Housing Board flats for a year.

item.title: 4-room Geylang BTO flats oversubscribed by 14 times
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Home seekers made a beeline for the four-room Build-To-Order (BTO) flats in Geylang, which saw one of the highest application rates in recent years.

item.title: Jobs Growth Incentive to spur hiring of older workers
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

It will tilt the balance in favour of them but this must go together with training, say analysts.

item.title: Foreign service key as Singapore navigates post-Covid-19 world: Vivian
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

The next decade will be critical for Singapore as it adjusts to disruptions in a post-Covid-19 world and finds an optimal role to play in the new normal, said Foreign Minister Vivian Balakrishnan yesterday.

item.title: Jobs Growth Incentive scheme prods firms to boost hires via wage savings: Josephine Teo
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

The Jobs Growth Incentive will help companies get very substantial savings on their wage bill, allowing them to be bolder in manpower expansion and bring forward hiring, Manpower Minister Josephine Teo said in a Facebook post yesterday.

item.title: Fatal road accidents fall in first half, but speeding cases rise
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

With less traffic on the roads during the circuit breaker period, traffic accidents resulting in injuries or fatalities fell by more than 30 per cent in the first half of this year.

item.title: From retail to early childhood education: Mid-career worker shares her experience
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Job hunting is always daunting, but it is even more so now for older, mid-career workers such as Ms Lau Disan, who recently moved from the retail sector to early childhood education.

item.title: Prominent Sikh community leader and nursing pioneer dies, aged 81
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

A prominent Sikh community leader and pioneer in the nursing field in Singapore, who was also well known in the football fraternity, died on Monday after a bout of ill health. He was 81.

item.title: More passengers allowed to transit at Changi Airport
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

A small but significant step will see more footfalls return to Changi Airport, which has seen passenger numbers dry up in the wake of the global pandemic.

item.title: Hungry Ghost Festival to be quieter this year amid Covid-19 pandemic
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

The Covid-19 pandemic has upended lives in the physical world, but even the spiritual realm has not been spared.

item.title: Durian lovers in thorny situation as orders fail to bear fruit
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

It was a more bitter than sweet experience for some 200 durian lovers who made large orders with an online seller only to be left with empty promises.

item.title: On the hunt for a new job
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 120 job seekers turned up at a job fair organised by NTUC's Employment and Employability Institute (e2i) and held at Bukit Panjang Community Centre yesterday.

item.title: Mosquito repellent given to students as number of dengue cases still high
item.description:
August 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Dengue cases fell by around 20 per cent last week, but weekly numbers remain high, the National Environment Agency (NEA) said yesterday.

item.title: The New Normal: How work has changed due to Covid-19
Embrace senior workers for a fair and inclusive workplace
item.description:
August 19, 2020 4:00 AM

The Tripartite Alliance for Fair & Progressive Employment Practices (Tafep) addresses questions on employment opportunities and practices for senior workers

item.title: Employers reminded to schedule migrant workers for routine testing: MOM
item.description:
August 19, 2020 1:11 AM

SINGAPORE - Around 15,000 employers - or 78 per cent - have logged into the swab registration system since it was launched on Aug 1 to schedule their workers for Rostered Routine Testing (RRT).
